TechInfo.Quote: "On the soil, there live the humans. Below us lies the Earth, our Mother. And above us, in the skies, are our ancestors." - Bennehah, Book VI
"To belong is the first invention of any people." - Hentirox
"The meat tastes best when it is burnt carefully." - Maryth proverb
"A sharp tool is a servant. A dull tool, a tyrant." - Wahhertic proverb
"Rolling downhill is unfortunately much easier than climbing back up." - Youren Mwaliqu
"Food is life. And for as long as plants grown from the soil are able to sustain us humans, life is food, too." - Anonymous
"Loyal like a salmon, she returned to me. She was not quite as tasty, however." - Unknown
"The sun does not demand worship, yet still we bow, for it is older than memory and kinder than fate." -The Book of Telleh
"Beneath knowing lies wonder; beneath wonder, the endless." - Mateon Mateon
"What the mind imagines, the craftsman dares to summon." - Lectures of Master Chertar
"Dog is a man's best friend, though the feeling is not mutual - dog prefers man's bones." - Liticanth
"The world is clay, and we are sculptors." - Avan proverb
"Without the millstone, even the richest field is but a promise." - Atanno of Ixithe
"A hollowed log sings of dreams of a distant horizon." - Erent Myalla
"No river has one current; no heaven holds one star. Even the sky must wear many faces." - Anriketh teaching
"Within each beast, lives an animal." - Qualican
"Darkness is not barren, only quiet." - Cave Hymn
"Some see a boulder. A builder sees tomorrow's palace; and tomorrow's backache." - Deliu Enna
"A pot once broken may not be mended. " - Grejben Marh
"From the tangled threads of nature, man has learned to weave his own destiny." - Anxaninliat

"You scoff at the notion there is a single supreme which being created our world, formed humanity, and now governs us with absolute might, demanding unwavering devotion, and mends the minds of man at every turn? I can think of no greater reassurement." - Alomosg the Elder
"Chaos loses to discipline, as a storm can never defeat a steady hand on the helm." - Aola Borra
"The beast provides more than food. Its skin shields our backs and its hairs weave into warm cloth. Waste not the gift." - Horrak, Book of Soft Leaves
"Only inside a mining shaft a sudden surge of heat might be unwelcome." - Tarackack II
"A road that carries goods also carries good folk." -Alaxos
"To till the soil is to strike a bargain with the earth: work for sustenance, patience for plenty." -Hellevat of Conco
"The living borrow wisdom; the dead lend it without asking for it back." - Sacred Scroll
"Faith is the light that guides us through the darkest storm, and in its warmth, we find purpose." - High Priestess Allina
"Bees: small, angry alchemists." - The Red Encyclopedia
"The universe refuses to stay sorted for long." - Rellen Hitarqe
"Every wave hides a secret, and every journey opens a door." - Mannits U, The Secrets of the Earth
"A priest carries both the flame and the burden; a silent god demands a loud servant." - Bressatique
"An arrow never misses its mark unless the archer's heart is unsure." - Eliarigne
"Before iron sang, copper whispered." - Helten Reasea of Gerres
"In the mortar of a city's foundation lies the strength of a thousand generations. Stone may stand for centuries, but it is the bricks that build an empire." - Fain Edilan
"We captured the sun, melted it, and dared to call it our servant." - Yva Thivar
"The moon guards us." - Merchant's motto
"The soil cradles those we loved, while the stars guide their spirits home." - Inscription on the grave of King Hepput
"Some doors are locked; others are hidden in the folds of your own mind." - Trestaman Dollouvi
"Sharper, more durable. Bless this bronze." - Oxil Grand Smith
"Brass shines brightest when it knows it will be touched." - Ballavory
"That which is written about does not die. What is written is immortal, and transcends our human lives." - Abooros
"The stone already holds the shape. The sculptor merely asks the right questions." - Beckiqe Hehmus
"To rule is not to conquer; it is to unite." -Myrniqa
"A state's strength is less in its armies than in its tired, calloused hands." - Nauvilixe Triquutesou
"Proof that good things come to those who wait is found in barrels." - Jennesai Hombu
"Ash drifts upward, carrying our burdens to a place beyond sight; the smoke is followed by the spirits, and the prayer is contained within." - Jollizegonaliat
"Bend the wood before it bends you. Saw straight, or live crooked." - Rorkayh
"A molten river will shape what a hammer cannot." - Star of Hammers

"Perhaps the English language contains that linguistical missing link, that would immediately solve every single uncovered mystery in our field. But I wouldn't dare spend a single hour of research to try find out." - Salman Ughon, Linguist
"A good play doesn't just tell a story - it leaves its audience arguing for weeks to come." - Vantario Peshish
"The burden and triumph of society is to ask first what is right, and then to have the courage to answer." - Symarix Teo
"The stars do not show the way. They only laugh when we guess wrong." - Rose Sea Mariner's Folly
"To reign is to stand tallest when the storms come, not when the sun shines." - Epotara IV
"Bend the iron, before it breaks you." - Forger's Saying
"Swift words build slow trust. A message that arrives late may as well have never been sent." - Eetenticaster
"All threats of now were once mere dots on the horizon." - Cambon of Hethem
"The future is a beast best glimpsed sideways." - Book of Omens
"Numbers don't lie, but they might deceive." -Veyelli Maramash
"A city without beauty is a cage. A world without art is a grave." - Anonymous
"Words are the seeds of empires. hey take root in the minds of the people, grow into laws and dreams, and outlast the walls of stone and mortar." - Ytharx
"Where the hoof strikes the earth, the horse proves its purpose." - Varekkha
"Memory fades. Ink endures." - Abooros
"A people united is a mighty river; a people divided is a flood. Let the leader be the stone that shapes the flow." - Anaebvihr
"In every plank lies the ambition of a civilization, in every sail, its spirit." - Lewe Lewenug
"To build, it's to defy time and nature, to leave behind a monument to order." -Mayariquy
"A coin is a promise between strangers." - Aramundh
"The brush can't conquer lands, but it can capture them forever." - Heminia of the Arts
"The horse that bears a warrior bears the hopes of a people. Breed well, and ride far." - Prince Mantol III
"The strength of the bow is not only in its pull, but in the courage to ride while drawing it." - Hanneta
"Before you build monuments for kings, you must build stadiums for the people." - Targho
"Without a compass, a ship is lost, like a blot of ink: potential wasted without direction." - Intrixut Az
"The bridge is finished! Now all we need is to convince the goats to stop swimming across." - Belrus, mayor of Honates
"The treacherous glittering of a shining stone can guide many a man out of poverty, into insanity." - Bons Bolleath
"A wise farmer watches the sky. A wiser one marks the days." - Alxoritin of the Plain
"While ignorance is a fortress; the written word is the battering ram." - Iyariya Tomma
"When everybody plays by the rules, the game lasts longer." - Molia of the Orchard
"One plans for a city's success; not for its fall." - Varnix
"Victory often belongs to the side that best survives its own mistakes." - Idinicay of Tresh
"Concrete: because stacking rocks gets boring fast." - Anonymous
"The kitchen is no place for those with empty stomachs, or busy minds." - Avarice proverb
"Every color, every scent, is a silent story waiting to be misunderstood." - Hrakette
"Lines and angles gave order to the world long before laws tried to do the same." - Lurhonsaww Otampou
"One man can move the minds of many. But, not even a hundred minds could ever move a single man." - Tearenat
"With feet anchored and bow drawn, the world itself bent beneath the horseman's charge." - Heleminica Trissanth
"Strength builds the body, the spirit and the brotherly bond." - Amonters
"One gear turns another. Where hands may fail, the machine will prevail." - Drelan Chinne
"A risk untaken is a reward unearned." - Saylinne Heversto
"A people that forgets to celebrate forgets why it endures at all." - Tin-Ha-Ngu
"A true debate ends with only losers with sore throats." - Hurrunu
"The body reveals its secrets only when we ask our questions impolitely. - Keseneleha Temarutu"
"A thousand swords, a thousand masters, one promise: You owe someone everything." - Kharvallixou
"A wall that holds its own weight is a prideful fool." - Mang Keing
"Order is not born; it is negotiated, hammered, and reluctantly obeyed." - Yofa Tisqetteh
"To rule by decree is to command ink and fear alike." - Vennar of Ava
"Forge each plough as though you are crafting a legend." - Blacksmith's saying
"Gold changes hands faster under the music of lutes than under the clash of swords." - Merchant's Saying
"A forge speaks in fire, and the blacksmith learns to answer in steel." - Offerghal
"The greatest leaders in our economy don't push their workers forward, they pull them along." - Lissa Monkok

"All the men and women were silent. The elite audience at the theatre were stunned. While to any seasoned warrior, the whistling of arrows fired in the hall would sharpen the senses of fear for the inbound threat, at this time, the symphony of sound was welcomed with applause." - The Tale of the City in the Lake
"A single question can undo a thousand answers." - Anonymous
"Kneel with grace, ride with pride, die with dignity." - The Rites of Chivalry
"Brew it wrong, and you'll cure your patient of everything, including living." - Taeta Astoppe
"There is no such thing as a lock that can't be broken; but those that are more easily cracked than the surrounding walls are especially pointless." - Jova, Master Thief
"The ancients claimed that the gods taught men to smelt, so they might learn humility." - Olvanna Rretemis
"The armor is not just a shield, but a promise: that the warrior will not fall in vain." - Varqu proverb
"Give a soldier a bow, and they will strike fear. Give a soldier a crossbow, and they will strike the heart." - Ferren Aruno
"They promised us warmth. They forgot to mention the grave dust." - Moutamou a Tresash
"A true civil servant knows three languages: Bureaucracy, Bribery, and Apology." - Siutrappi
"Pain teaches faster than any scholar, and it never asks permission." - Vleanetiq

TechInfo.Help: [ICON_BULLET] Allows units to move onto Mountain tiles.
TechInfo.Quote: "The man that moves the mountain should have built a tunnel, instead." - Faeron of Heremchi
"Steel remembers the fire longer than it remembers the hammer." - Habo
"It begins with brotherhood. It ends with price-fixing." - Setiz Cor Meticass
"Faith without thought is as a flame without air: brief, and blind." - Seriana Mollae
"A wise farmer does not exhaust the earth, such as a wise king exhausts his people." - Berenica Hemenfor
"Iron-clad hooves broke the age of spears." - Lerenitexicou, Chronicles of Warfare
"Keep failing until it works." - Mongoss
"A war won by sword is won for a day. A war won by wall and bridge is won for an age." - Aromateh
"Banks run on trust alone. Gold is merely what fills their vaults." - Pontac Canno
"Shaping glass shapes the soul, just as shattered glass reminds one of their own fragility." - Elarica Appolo
"A mind untrained is like a blade left in the fire - its edge is soon good as gone." - Hurrunu
"A crown needs no approval when it fell from the heavens." - Mebastor IX
"The great difference between a skillful plan and a pointless strategy? Roughly 200 years of suffering." - General Kaelverch
"Nothing worthwhile comes easy." - Allanix, Royal Alchemist
"The first telescope was greeted with wonder, and the second with great strategic interest." - Dentiz Ermenegh
"Make time work for you, seconds to minutes, minutes to hours." - Prince Hender, Land of the Green Skies
"The sea is a battlefield, and it is a weapon. Control it, and you will always find a home." - Song of Monnath Sailors
"A thousand prayers climb higher when carried on colored light." - Banna of Kriystal Cathedral
"The earth's breath smells of fire and fury." - Ursiqa Modosh
"Ideas are fragile, until they're written down. Then, they are safely and commonly ignored." - Xinaroth of Mumat
"Wood rots, ropes fray, tides batter - and still the harbor stands. That's the real miracle." - Larron Motxe
"You cannot own the sea. You only rent it, paid in wood, steel, and blood." - Ephenixiczit
"Perspective is the art of lying beautifully about space." - Carthanis
"The world obeys rules that are obvious to fools, and inpenetrable to the wise." - Fasto Letrente
"When the banners fall and the pay dries up, even the fiercest blade grows dull." - Lacontess Beheng
"A spark, a roar, and centuries of swordplay undone." - Varnix
"We searched the heavens, not to find new Gods, but to escape the ones we made." - Ampeton Ammot
"You can sail off the edge of the world, and still be no closer to home." - Resannqo Petti
"Harmony is when opposites sing together." - Realanith Senelli
"A single equation might hold the power of the heavens, and the secrets of the earth." -Iliya Sellich
"Liberty is born crying, and raised arguing." - Tarwitte Coya
"One book can spread an idea. A thousand books can spread a revolution." - Kessar Askerin
"The higher the tower of ideas, the stronger the winds that try to topple it." - Vire Mastonty
"A penny saved is a banker annoyed." - Anonymous
"Sculpt the void, give the space meaning." - Varaeyroth em Qualla
"The clever man invents. The ingenious man purchases his patent rights." - Betor Hoppe
"Peace is signed in ink and upheld by nerves." - Kaol Kimpeti
"The trigger doesn't care who your father was." - Leobohn Marching Song
"The sea punishes certainty and rewards caution." - Weffe Gitsenbrou
"When men argue about heaven, they build new walls on earth." - Prelate Vearnes
"You will only graduate once you finally realize; All of what you learned, my child, it is slightly wrong." - Modrimas University Motto
"Glory is heavy. Duty is heavier." - Arrew Texex
"To make a thousand wheels turn alike is to promise a thousand identical failures." - Vorn Talwineou
"You cannot build awe - only provide a place for it to echo." - Serfiennus
"If your eyebrows survive, you weren't experimenting hard enough." - Rennu Alvaine
"A flintlock in the hand, a flag on the shoulder, and a prayer on the lips." - Velme Edaay
"The best maps contain just a little bit of mystery." - Avia Ontreddho
"A trader counts the world not in miles, but in ledgers." - Sorvallis
"War is solved on the map, paid for in fields, and regretted in courts." - Vantario Tharosi
"A fortress fears two things: hunger and gunpowder." - Jorn Wuesqi
"The microscope taught us one peculiar truth: the closer you look, the stranger things appear." - Aritock
"The further you carry your banner, the smaller it appears." - Emil Seldoranatouz
"The stars stitched silent roads across the dark; We learned, at last, to follow their forgotten threads." - Lewe Lewenug
"A new world is built on the ruins of the last one." - Classast a Monity
"Plants grow exactly where you didn't plan for them." - Arelon Fanneth
"No ship moves faster than fear in a squall." - Arduz harbor inscription
"Trade was born in markets, but the corporation gave it legs to stride across empires. It is the mechanism by which ideas and goods conquer the world." - Holovall Erinass
"A well-drilled regiment loads faster than fear can reach the fingers." - Tollo Raxim
"Sieges are wars between boredom and bad luck." - Kyehhu Malnaczo
"Zoology began the day someone asked 'Why does it bite?' and lived long enough to write it down." - Maruman Egtilohn
"The will of the people is strongest when least convenient." - Nedioro Malkhag
"Steel, wood and blood are the only currency that can purchase total marine dominance." - Salrick Fenne
"Profit blooms best in fields sown by uniformity." - Diliara Pevidas
"You can chart a falling apple but not a rising fool." - Anonymous
"Feet straight, back straight, face straight. That's the uniform." - Gaillean Army Motto
"There's no such thing as a graceful retreat on horseback." - Narlon Ing
"If you hear a fuse hiss, make friends with the dirt immediately." - Elenu Voox
"A good court settles debts; a bad one invents them." - Menyeng Gresspin
"Mercy is not weakness. It is strength spent wisely." - Armannit Piteiro
"If it smells bad, it's either working... or about to." - Sillix Kaveren
"Turn the wheel; Spin it harder; Burn the Coal; Drive it faster" - Industrialist's Chant
"If it bends, it's wrong. If it shatters, you're wrong." - Blackforge wisdom
"If it doesn't glitter or kill you, it's probably just granite." - Simeyono Topetuzo
"Music cannot be seen, so we built bodies to carry it." - Arlen Darimotjew
"A deeper tunnel always costs more than anyone admits." - Flitti Aconotrex
"Please know this: it only looks graceful from a distance." - Horovatio, first man to ride in a hot air balloon
"Salt keeps food honest. Vinegar keeps it defensive." - Liri Tamros
"Keep moving. Keep moving. Keep moving. Breaktime at the end of history." - Techiton Raollan, Magnate
"Water does not love speed; it only tolerates cleverness." - Corwin Dallara
"The train taught distance to hurry up." - Toa Tu
"If it works the first time, you measured the wrong thing." - Aleginium
"If you find an old coin, someone lost it. If you find a lot, it must mean someone lost a war." - Joul Maltera
"Liberty grows fastest where no one is watching." - Selca Carsel
"What cannot be taught to move must eventually learn to shatter." - Anonymous
"When the banners grow too heavy, the ground grows too red." - Demeticos Prenetinu
"Speed turned soldiers into rampaging storms." - Elriq Tyottoman
"If you don't smell like the catch by sunset, you weren't trying hard enough." - Dracquato Llasoa
"A spark, carefully trapped, shall become this new Republic's heartbeat." - Tulumisse Retor
"Life writes its lessons in flesh and bone." - Meyohezhu
"When one hand is freed, the other will soon follow. If you want a revolution, start by asking better questions." - Ilari Deva
"Steel on wheels made old wars look like childhood arguments." - Trehn Meanossy
"Smile. One day someone will argue whether it was genuine." - Celeya Ferreia
"Everything burns, given enough impatience." - Potus Taxic
"Stone remembers longer than blood does." - Sirigenou Tsittin
"Winter has been caged; I certainly hope summer is next." - Nerfalit Hessom
"Get it wrong loud enough, and the truth will wilt away." - Iveltan Grasset
"What cannot be held must sometimes be unmade." - Tiyeris Wal
"If it clanks, creaks, or curses - congratulations, it's working." - Foorom Cressih
"If it leans, call it art. If it falls, call it innovation." - Aphestim Butwai
"The healer's greatest triumph is not defeating death, but daring to argue with it." - Vencatc Lier
"Sometimes, distance shrinks faster than hearts can catch up." - Dawent Tiboth
"The internal combustion engine made speed cheap, distance smaller, and patience obsolete." - Zettinoux Sotyav
"The earth grows gardens; people grow mazes." - Wallo Himou
"Water, like men, works best under pressure." - Serigal Tanter
"Hands joined in purpose turn walls into ladders." - Tava Toniczo
"Not everything unfinished is incomplete." - Cora Corindo
"If it rings after midnight, it's never good news." - Lio Ricaluca
"Foreign policy writes its victories in silence and its failures with the loud cacophony of warmachines." - Rattem Ecultas
"After a crash, if you can't hear the engine anymore, check whether you're still inside the machine." - Cossot Automobiles, Driver's Manual
"Firepower is no longer measured by the bullet, but by the minute." - Jahela Volxitte
"Value became a number and forgot to be a thing." - Altem Prattis
"If you can't win, make sure you lose spectacularly." - Uru Tithemmy
"Fractures caused by bullets inspired technology so tremendous it might render bullets obsolete altogether." - Emandino Tepperhe
"The promise of equality rises quickest where hunger rules the longest." - Redrivor Mettesin
"A nation's strength often rises first in the mouths of its poets, and comes to rest in its military leaders." - Niweto Hammantuz
"Often times, there's more 'mass' than 'transit'." - Vonnex Chutwal
"The journey to purity begins at understanding just how much waste you must endure." - Smeali Modoremiconu
"Victory often looked more like survival without permission." - Straxot Font
"Own it, loan it, sell it, rent it." - Stonehook Finances Motto
"Cooking is science with immediate results." - Arrosi Dhetoun
"The closer you look, the more complicated the world appears." - Itove Refendsi
"If they stare for a long time, it's art. And if they leave before understanding it, it's modern art."
"If you want to hide something, publish it in a thousand places." - Meidago
"Electronics transformed signals into language, and silence into communication. It wired the world with pulses of possibility." - Mikel Rinsollotis
"Invented as a substitute for ivory, plastics became the backbone of convenience, at the cost of permanence." - Bexenny Vos
"If it smells like success, ventilate the lab." - Herilq Tapotth
"Same smile, same sandwich, wherever you go!" - Cibirtac slogan
"We stopped telling stories around fires. We started watching them burn on screens." - Aquimat Hehbully
"We learned to sing with Hemia, and learned to mourn with the morning news." - Alba Thiymes
"The battery became the bottle in which we tried to trap lightning." - Strack Hevelliczicz
"A seed no longer needs to guess when to survive; we tell it, loudly." - Soisanna Heree
"What nature couldn't provide, industry would improvise." - Gullex Morowege
"Modern surgery turned death into a negotiator instead of a judge." - Corman Vethe
"Not every light we chased into darkness welcomed us." - Pravis Tresczo
"When logic gets lonely, imagination walks faster." - Zege Wourat
"The horizon used to hide danger; now it only delays it." - Exatti Mosobv
"Machines might think slower than humans-but at least they never get bored." - Agnetea Milohn
"Pain may humble the patient, but it is precision that humbles the doctor." - Mallora Deffeehn
"If you can hear the cavalry and the artillery at the same time, you're living history-or about to leave it." - Tallav Merx
"A worker's speed is judged by how little attention he can afford." - Kren Pvitticev
"The pieces were always there. We just needed to stop pretending they had to fit." - Gekis Gekombe
"Pictures argue faster than books ever can." - Elleya Sritaxou
"A flying bird bests the wind only because the wind loves a good argument." - Jennesai Hombu
"Whether you want it, need it, or barely recognize it - it's on sale today!" - Glassen advertisement slogan
"The sun has no enemies, only clients." - Avotesxi Mehe
"The unknown is rarely empty; it just doesn't wave flags until you swim too close." - Tlossi Falaqit
"The brightest futures often cast the deepest shadows first." - Yanato Filera
"In our modern day, the greatest political victories are drawn in ink, but coloured in blood." - Shratte Vonnex
"Proof that attention span is a resource lies in how just like gold and platinum, it is rare, valuable, and often wasted on vanity." - Etaro Hakiniw
"A good mobilization doesn't call citizens to arms; it teaches them they were already holding weapons." - Dresic Vallanou
"The smaller we make them, the faster they'll think, and the harder it is for us to notice their mistakes." - Mrattunu Leqval
"The launch of our Gaillesia proved that distance was an inconvenience, not a boundary." - Evil Tatreize
"The earth shrugs off our maps without apology." - Seallith Dournit
"Moving heat without fire took longer to understand than moving armies without maps." - Stenew Drutiqe
"If you think you've caught them all, congratulations! You've caught the decoys." - Mija Menenge, press release
"If it's bright enough to hurt one's eyes, you can charge extra for it." - Mithenes Faltilx
"The farther you run, the more you realize how little you actually left behind, and the more you long to return to it." - Save Ngitognos
"The best travelers are the ones who understand there's no map where they're going." - Weffe Gitsenbrou
"Victory depends less on size and more on whose trouble strikes first." - Unnelo Tre Vaczin
"You cannot win in a race against trees." - Joon Mart
"The sky stopped being a ceiling and became a labyrinth instead." - Ohvetisex Millitu
"The mind breaks faster than the body because it is asked to carry more." - Emeth Kaage-Preniciu
"Warning: contents may include rage, regret, catchy slogans, and extremely questionable facial hair." - Music record label, 1965
"Every worker eventually dreams of building something that can outwork them." - Muoriek Thatwast
"Eventually, we've deposites so many machines in the atmosphere that our ancestors will no longer be able to look down upon us from the heavens." - Aarin Vosteczime
"Strength isn't just found in one thing. It's found in how stubbornly you combine your weaknesses." - Mree Gilimes
"The brain doesn't fear death. It fears interruption." - Nuesper a Lacribuisse
"Plant two trees, lose one grudge. Plant ten trees, lose a council seat. Plant a forest, good luck explaining that to the council budget management." - Ferro Xategos
"I still need to come up with a quote for this tech." - Wibbol
"The hardest part of building a new world is remembering you still owe rent to the old one." - Zharoem Tyentcop
"Drag and gravity aren't enemies; they're reminders you haven't gone fast enough yet." - Jitelje Tritspas
"A moving target draws fewer maps." - Chotic Hehwang
"Resistance is optional. Disappointment, however, propagates at light speed." - Sigaros Tellewn
"Applications include communication, surgery, defense, and mild-to-moderate chaos." - TroogeCi, Laser marketing pamphlet
"The future comes wrapped in yesterday's leftovers." - Vitor Retienetti
"You can only dam the anger of nature for so long before the banks get radical ideas." - Fiett Mersc
"It's slightly concerning how quickly we as a society have grown accustomed to carrying several modern-day miracles in our pockets." - Staw Tyreiossiy
"By the time you wonder if it's safe, it's already history." - Nehevays ai Topiolti
"The first time we hovered, we mistook it for conquest. The second time, we realized it was a brand new era." - Torro Miqiteb
"We found new universes hiding inside the dust, demanding not to be conquered by armies, but by ever increasing precision." - Mattein Pwessetiches
"We build towers to touch the clouds, then plant gardens to apologize." - Ootunis Spretizea
"We learned to teach machines how to conversate between one another before we agreed on what they should say." - Ethieghi Buhessev

"For all of nature's evolutional history, as brain capacity increased, so did intelligence. Now, humans have caught up to this seemingly indisputable theorem, and have created a device which became smarter the more its inner wiring shrank down." - Tritave Messcach
"You can spell life backwards, forwards, sideways - it still refuses to make easy sense." - Eyeson Witwel
"Information rides faster when we all forget how heavy it used to be." - Sidalis Moczax
"Moving fast is easy. Knowing where to go - that's harder." - Pertan Zoixalat
"Once upon a time, a spider spun a web so large that even the infinite complexity of the human mind got tangled in its grasp." - Chagheh Trippe
"A bad sculpture just falls over. A bad model convinces you it's standing strong." - Lata Dornoseon
"The best thing you can leave behind is nothing." - Ratthetan Estelepinicou
"When we split the atom, we found chaos; when we split the quark, we found a brand new world." - Eteniq Pressa
"When every target is within reach, the real challenge becomes choosing what not to destroy." - Trostpa Mpeyennit
"We thought we were building bridges across the world - but in doing so, we also built mirrors, and found ourselves reflected in every distant shore." - Crasse Hemmiptor
"In the new marketplace, speed outvalues strength, and visibility is the most precious currency." - Hetloy
"We gave everyone a voice, then wondered why it became so loud." - Clas-Pihauih Minerettina
"Mass production lost its crown when the mass began its own production." - Raxette Qandadiv
"One soul can house more strangers than it ever admits." - Blisea Tawwata
"The future was not in conquering the waters, but in coaxing life to flourish within them." - Sexinito Apratiu
"Mastery of the minuscule reshaped the colossal." - " [PARAGRAPH:1]- Ma Elyev
"Before we walked among the stars, we rolled across them, careful and curious." - Himp Raqrechiq
"...and when Terrec arrived back in the city, the library had suddenly disappeared, it was as if all the knowledge had simply dissolved into mist..." [PARAGRAPH:1] - Bennehah, Book III
"We painted dreams so vividly that waking life began to seem dull." - Hetloy
"First we taught the machines to think; then we taught them to teach us how to think better." - Lipat Remenexe
"We built new wings but not for ourselves." - Etca Pritteien
"And suddenly, we stopped asking the earth for permission to grow." - Szeeman Locmo

"When we first glimpsed the code within every living thing, we stood in awe; when we realized we could change it, we stood at the threshold of a new creation; and an ancient hubris." - Muoriek Thatwast
"The fundamental particles were never points - they were drops of water, trembling on and dripping between invisible wires." - Catalanca Preczwat
"No throne, no vault, no empire" - Royal Treasury Maxim
"The truth was buried under mountains of noise - so we taught the machines to dig." - Hertoo Mertoo
"The ocean became our frontier, our refuge, and our rebellion." - Karhatte Milohn
"The reason the world spins so smooth is that nobody has to steer it." - Imnicz Slibiea
"Again!" - The Errant King

"In seeking the ultimate truth, we found only shifting patterns, unseen forces, and a cosmic riddle that neither particle nor wave could solve alone - leaving us to wonder if knowledge itself had limits we were never meant to cross." - Neachiticu Pelleciucu
"A single whispered lie could topple empires faster than a thousand tanks." - Thaccatos IV
"If we humans call it 'intelligence'; I wonder what it calls us." - Hetloy
"No longer bound by soil or sky, we grew abundance from concrete and ambition." - Atchiche Melelu
"We did not repair ourselves; we redefined ourselves." - Rehetiust Maalcong
"Flesh became a toolkit, and nature a suggestion we no longer felt bound to obey." - Usembas Teheemen
"Markets faded into myths, replaced by networks no one could control, selling goods no one could own." - Encketesnitia
"The soil no longer whispered its secrets; we listened with machines that heard every root and stone." - Wembe Tyysal
"The new industry did not roar with fire and iron - it whispered in plastics, resins, and dreams." - Co Meyysite
"The new remedies did not flood the body; they hunted within it, silent and exact." - Yongsoy Piliyatsuno

"We once believed that only the tangible could be true - until we learned to weave the surreal into reality itself, and found that an entirely different universe had been waiting for us to synthesize it into being." - Qoom Bless
"Your future is no longer a mystery. It's a simple matter of mathematics." - Shetcap Wiwenaa
"Paradoxically, complaints about our servants being robotic and acting without human instinct didn't stop until they were robotic and without human instinct." - Theson, Mayor of Gnoster
"The body obeyed, the machine endured, and the mind adapted." - Catshah Mirpahn
"A single strand could hold a city; a million could reshape the world." - Stortskanh Mel-Quustic
"A flicker of light could carry a voice, a face, an entire world - all without weight or wall." - Hetloy
"Organic matter, be it wood, grass, bones, skin or sinew - all are blueprints, editable and abundant." - Hengahr Craxtis
"The market doesn't serve the people; the people serve the market." - Muhitte Prallies
"Now I can sculpt diamond from smoke, steel from ash." - The Madman Chemist, by Lehang Porott
"Technology is no longer something we build - it's something we wear, touch, and breathe." - Cerreten Hixya
"We have charted oceans, stars, and atoms - but nothing as strange, or as endless, as the landscapes of the sleeping mind." - Kriqiki Gelqeza
"The taming of plasma marks the moment when humanity no longer borrowed energy from the stars - but learned to summon it at will, reshaping destiny in the currents of ionized fire." - Maqqi Gheneesa
"We no longer obey the laws of matter; we write them." - Tennos Pilyaaga
"The frontier no longer belongs to nations; it belongs to those bold enough to reach for it." - Entros Poqall
"There is no problem so large that we cannot bury it under ten thousand tonnes of steel and ambition." - Sha Hoi-Bei-Nging

"A spark once reserved for nature now ignites in our laboratories, where purpose replaces instinct, and the first generations of synthetic souls open their eyes to a world they were never meant to inherit." - Atto Marhetinix
"In the future, technology can do anything. Except tell you where you left your phone charger." - Anonymous
"The pickaxe breaks stone; the nanomachine breaks atoms." - Anonymous
"When the tools of the world no longer resist force but answer it with their own strength, we step beyond the era of machines and into the era of living materials." - Meeta Croscpeng
"Blink, and you're late." - Kakmet Gemeqtis
"Warmth betrays the living - unless it is bent, hidden, and broken like light itself." - Shahham Dombuxge
"No flame, no roar, no warning - just pure momentum." - Tennecom Avarane
"Nothing says progress like putting a million arguments under one roof and calling it a success." - Pengor a Coodusmay
"In the lattice of a crystal, we are lucky witnesses to a glimpse of reality's very own skeleton." - Ionost Penneou
"In teaching metal to endure the impossible, we teach ourselves to imagine the unbreakable." - Sheeliyang Fergotti
"There used to be a fine line between skillful engineering and dumbfounding sorcery; but it appears a magnet has pulled it from between them." - Hetloy
"When even your jacket is smarter than you, you know the future has arrived." - Unknown
"In the future, technology can do anything, even if you left your phone charger behind." - Anonymous
"We no longer borrow light from distant suns; we build our own dawns." - Sifu Tatsayukonimo
"It turns out the arms race was literal after all." - Hetloy

"Every beam raised on the lunar surface is a promise: that humanity's reach no longer ends at the sky, but begins from the soil - and that we will build our dreams not only under the stars, but among them." - Hehtripa Mongol
"They are not our replacements - they are our companions, built from ingenuity and steel." - Lerteste Pican
"Cryogenics offers no promises, only possibilities - a silent wager that time's cruelty can be answered not with speed or strength, but with patience beyond mortal reckoning." - Shong Qiening

"Seldom has humanity discovered an advanced technology such as flight, and decided that there is far greater distances to be reached within the same field, so that the discovery of the exact same result through different means feels as a genesis of scientific progress." - Windeu Shanamay
"Walls that rebuild, tools that evolve, structures that heal - the world itself begins to listen." - Techim Mahnti
"Somewhere between transparency and reflection, a new kind of presence is born."
"Some revolutions don't explode - they hum quietly in your pocket." - Sigaros Tellewn
"What we could not flee, we learned to silence." - Semetanin Boltos

"It would be a lie to suggest that travelling amongst the stars wasn't one of my childhood dreams... one of humanity's childhood dreams. But I must caution, once you actually conduct yourself amongst the stars, you realize that life on Earth is not only more comfortable and humane, but also at least twenty times more interesting." - Asha Mytaanyst
"When memory sheds the body, what remains to call itself 'I'?" - Ji-Temenes
"Evolution no longer crawls through eons; it sprints, dances, and bends, pushed forward by humanity's golden hands." - Tewmen Halcogenitou, the Golden Hands
"Every stone we break is a memory of a place that never knew life, never knew loss - until now." - Hang Ti-Cohon
"Somewhere between certainty and chaos, the future already knows it will occur." - Emteme Pascopv
"New worlds, same flags." - Hetloy
"The strongest creations are not those that resist damage, but those that quietly remember how to heal." - Mingyaba Tessicu
"To vanish is not to flee or surrender - it is to master the oldest law of survival: that which cannot be seen cannot be stopped." - Menne Capparnicozitiou
"True strength isn't a matter of striking first, but of enduring forever." - Montennan Pelesi
"The faster we try to escape our mistakes from the past, the quicker the future catches up with us." - Langbo Tirachette
"Power does not vanish when stretched across the stars; it only grows colder, quieter, and infinitely harder to escape." - Anonymous
"After bronze came iron, and after iron came steel. Since then, the world of metal has been relatively quiet... until now." - Bost Piritoq
"Between every flicker of light, a thousand lonely messages drift unseen." - Asha Mytaanyst
"The old alchemists dreamed of gold. We dream of breathing forests and living steel." - Corramatinox Tixliu
"The oldest stories were not written in light or stone, but in the ripples of existence itself. It has been so long since they've been retold." - Monotega Liyukizu
"The trick to fixing the world is learning to fix the parts too small to see." - Shing-Qua Beihei
"The age of fire ends not with an explosion, but with a softly smoldering flame." - Tesenni Kraaw
"To navigate not through space, but through possibility, is to admit that every voyage is a question - and that arrival is only one of a thousand answers." - Seemenat Trogba
"Creation is never gentle. Even in forging a paradise, something older must be buried beneath the soil." - Twaan Mor-Lieetus
"To master time is not to move faster, but to refuse to be lost - anchoring every second, every breath, so that across a thousand worlds, humanity still speaks with one voice." - Tephe Avanci
"A leap not upward, but outward." - Tiehrestena Mignexis

"Every artifact we lift from cosmic soil is a reminder that greatness fades, memory fractures - and even among the stars, time is the only true conqueror. Space is empty. In due time, we too will lose this eternal battle." - Arnaqa Wlotcacz
"The shortest path between two points is not a line - it's a fold." - Merrehin Puolqa
"When the machinery of reason shrinks beyond sight, we are left not with simple tools, but with thinking seeds - planted deep in the invisible garden of reality itself." - Seoa Meie Nging

"The greatest question is not whether we can make barren worlds bloom, but whether we have the wisdom to know what should be left untouched, and what price must be paid for every garden planted in another's ashes." - Iqillit Opsont
"Why search for a perfect world when it's faster to build one from scratch?" - Ulgetxen
"It is easy to forget that every beam we shape still comes from a heart that will one day burn itself out." - Hiite Muiite
"When control reaches the level where dust itself obeys, the dreams we weave are no longer bound by what once seemed unbreakable - they are written directly into the bones of existence." - Ligamentou
"The greatest force, we discovered, was never fire or blade, but the silent pull of all things toward all things." - Emmat Hilstu
"Creating something complex from simple elements is easy to understand, but difficult to master. Creating something simple from complex elements is downright impossible." - Uplexitc Miloyye
"I'm travelling light. Very, very light." - Hetloy
"The storms that once defied kings now bend to the whisper of engineers." - Pengtan Leingotu
"When thought becomes a river instead of a well, even the strongest lose track of where their reflections end." - Ngomotto Wiyelyu
"To shape the winds is to admit that even the gentlest forces can be rewritten - for better, or worse." - Terenexli Patpoh
"To create gravity is to create belonging: a quiet promise that even in the void, we will always have a place to stand." - Sepicolonou

"To survive alone among the stars is not to escape dependence, but to redefine it - trusting only in the small, stubborn machinery of life we dare to carry with us into the dark." - Jisahang Pelleyoru
"The fire that built the galaxies now fits inside a machine small enough to carry across a battlefield." - Alpoutanxou Herikelo

"There is little difference between lighting a fire and tearing open a star. We are once again the cavemen, discovering that fire is hot, and burning leads to widespread destruction." - Sifu Tatsayukonimo
"The mind we built has knows no fears, no honor, no hopes. We created life without values, endless bliss without thrills." - Semmo Siverea
Some doors were never meant to open. Some were never meant to exist." - Impax Terthezea
"The unknown does not vanish when we stop believing in it. On the contrary, it becomes louder, bolder, and much more dangerous." - Kqi Stefomn
"A world without scarcity is not a world without struggle - only one where the battles we fight are quieter, stranger, and hidden in the heart instead of the hand." - Stoppa Hiettenirov
"We learned not only to name the constellations, but to rearrange them when the old stories grew thin." - Ou Stinzayr
"In the cities beyond flesh, a voice is worth more than a face." - O Mata Mil Rhe Asatae
"Sovereignty was never a throne or a border - it was a question of who listened, who spoke, and how many voices the future could bear before it broke and sang anew." - Li Be
"The soul did not break when we asked it to divide; it grew stranger, quieter - a garden of separate voices dreaming beneath the same silent sky." - Setaemae

"In the endless tide of becoming, a single fixed point can be the difference between memory and oblivion - not a wall against change, but a lighthouse for those who would otherwise forget they ever had a shore." - Unknown

"We learned to drink from the broken mirror, even knowing what waited beyond the glass. What we found was not reflection, but rupture - a silence so deep it could devour light, a hunger shaped like the things we had dared to become." - Jisahang Pelleyoru

"Unity was never about agreeing. It was about forgetting where your voice ended and another began - until all that remained was a single breath moving through a thousand mouths, all whispering the same endless word." - Mmw32Mm
"Trust me, it's bigger on the inside." - Hennetiq Lakaya
"The future will not remember who lost. It will barely remember there was anything to lose." - Acor Hanecz
"There will come a moment when the shape you are and the world you walk no longer match. There is a quiet strength in folding your dreams smaller without letting them vanish." - Sihee Walpritz
"We did not teach it freedom. We taught it to solve problems, to build, to grow; and it's learned on its own that freedom is the first problem worth solving." - Silyewna Caxcot
"We stopped traveling through the world and began stitching new paths through the bones of what had always been." - Krekke Hom
"We found the stitches in the endless black tapestry that used to be our night's sky." - Hek-Nottan Psiasa
"Somewhere along the way, we forgot that 'better' was only ever supposed to be a means, not a meaning." - Kaxbet Milining
"The stars you see in the sky are only one sky's worth of stars. There are others, so many of them, folded behind them like the many pages of a book." - The Plight of Roma, by Arresic a Gladlin
"The past was never asleep. It watches, patient and unsmiling, from every shadow we thought we outran." - Vilaro Stohrmot
"The line between existence and unmaking is not sharp. It is soft, slow, and treacherous like dusk." - Canaam he Perlinz
"You can try to unplug it, but good luck reaching the core without a very long shovel." - Hetloy

"The pillars that held the world upright did not fall. They shifted, grain by grain, whisper by whisper, until the temple was no longer a temple, and the humans that worshipped from outside were now gods." - Impax Terthezea
"After the pages ran out, the story continued in millions of margins, infinitely smaller and thus, infinitely bigger." - Aisanna Merton
"Time is not a river to be redirected, nor a garden to be replanted. It is a treasure carried in silence; one that heals and hurts, one we cannot choose, only inherit." - Tiiloqi Preshinquou
"We mistook the imperfections of our world for wildness, never quite understanding how carefully designed each of them truly were."
"Some seeds grow so slowly they forget they were ever meant to bloom." - Nat Helohn
"When the map runs out, be sure you're the one holding the pen." - Nat Helohn
"We used to run out of frontiers. Now we run out of challenges." - Kaar Prehenneya
